### Download and install [Docker](https://neurohackweek.github.io/docker-for-scientists/) [Mac](https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-mac/install/) [Windows](https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-windows/install/) [Linux](https://docs.docker.com/install/linux/docker-ce/ubuntu/)
##### Increase Docker's memory useage: Preferences > Advanced > increase the memory limit to maximum > hit "Apply & Restart" 

### Running MRIQC locally using Docker
##### Download mriqc
```{r, engine = 'bash', eval = FALSE}

docker pull poldracklab/mriqc:0.10.4
    #pull image from Docker Hub registry
    #saves image within the depths of Docker (not to the location you downloaded it from)
```

##### Run mriqc
```{r, engine = 'bash', eval = FALSE}

inputdir = '/path_to_repo/open_neuroscience_workshop/data/bids_dir/'  #specify directory where bids formatted data lives
outputdir = '/path_to_repo/open_neuroscience_workshop/data/bids_dir/derivatives/' #specify output (derivatives) directory

docker run --rm -it \  
    #run container, clean up after container exits, run in interactive mode
  -v ${inputdir}:/data:ro \ 
    #-v gives docker access to the input directory. ro = read only
  -v ${outputdir}:/out \  
    #tell docker where to populate output data.
  poldracklab/mriqc:0.10.4 /data /out participant  
    #specify container image, input folder, output folder, run analyses on participant level

```
